thread.title: 'Family Guy' makes fun of Flint water crisis in latest episode
thread.title_full: 'Family Guy' makes fun of Flint water crisis in latest episode

author: Detroit Free Press
title: 'Family Guy' makes fun of Flint water crisis in latest episode
text:
'Family Guy' makes fun of Flint water crisis in latest episode The Flint water crisis was the butt of another joke Sunday night, this time thanks to "Family Guy." Post to Facebook 'Family Guy' makes fun of Flint water crisis in latest episode The Flint water crisis was the butt of another joke Sunday night, this time thanks to "Family Guy."   Freep.com: http://on.freep.com/2m1eL9g   Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs 'Family Guy' makes fun of Flint water crisis in latest episode Brian Manzullo , Detroit Free Press 2:36 p.m. ET Feb. 20, 2017 Stewie Griffin from "Family Guy." (Photo: FOX) 124 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Flint water crisis was the butt of another joke Sunday night, this time thanks to "Family Guy." 
In the latest episode of the long-running cartoon series on Fox, Stewie Griffin, in an attempt to blind his grandfather in the shower, sneaks around the corner with Brian Griffin, the dog, and a spray bottle full of a brownish liquid. 
When Brian asks what Stewie has in the bottle, Stewie says, "It's just tap water from Flint, Michigan." 
"Family Guy" - known for its quick, comedic cut-scenes - then cuts to Stewie punching a sign that says "THINGS STEWIE CAN'T SAY," recognizing the poor taste of the joke. 
You can watch the full scene below (or tap on mobile ): 
This isn't the first time the Flint water crisis - which recently surpassed 1,000 days - was the butt of a joke. Last November, following Michigan's 30-27 loss to Ohio State in "The Game," a photo surfaced of Ohio State fans posing in front of a sign that said "Michigan girls: More diseased than Flint water," sparking outrage from many. 
"Family Guy," created by actor and producer Seth MacFarlane, debuted in 1999 and has long been known to test the boundaries of comedy. It has aired for 15 seasons and produced more than 280 episodes. 
Read more: Flint water documentary: It's still not over
